citation.article-title: Krokinobacter gen. nov., with three novel species, in the family Flavobacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Krokinobacter genikus sp. nov.
Krokinobacter genikus (ge′ni.kus. N.L. masc. adj. genikus from Gr. masc. adj. genikos principal, typical).
The species displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Colonies on marine agar 2216 are yellow and slightly convex.
Grows optimally at 20 °C and with 3 % salts.
Acetic acid is utilized, but mannitol is not utilized.
Unlike other Krokinobacter species, the cellular fatty acids do not contain arachidonic acid.
The DNA G+C content is 37–39 mol%.
The type strain is Cos-13T (=NBRC 100811T=CIP 108744T), isolated from marine sediment at Odawara, Japan.
Strains Cos-12 (=NBRC 100815) (isolated at Odawara) and CKS-39 (NBRC 100806) (isolated at Kisarazu) are reference strains.
